result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:34 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Merritt in court.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special appearance) in court for Matthew Mark Merritt.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.    DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   Bond Continues.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:46AM DEF Matthew M. Merritt in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF qualifies for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak has no objection.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 4/26/22 at 8:30AM.

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843.
